column5: Well I didn't remove any flowers, trimmed some suckers. This was from seeds I harvested last year from a rotten tomato on our farm about 1 lb. Grew 10 plants in my garage, it was cold but I once outside  Picked it Saturday at 2.5 lbs.
Mind sending me a few seeds from that giant??
Congrats, largest tomato I have seen,, your going to keep those seeds forsure Can u put me on the mail order list along with Gerritt
I'm cutting it open tomorrow and see how many it has, her mother had a few hope this does better. Have another coming along but it may only reach a pound or so.
HOLY FAT MATER Easy there Bat Man........LOL
What kind of tomatoe is that?  And whats the flavour like?  And wth do you even do with a tomatoe that big ???
What kind of tomatoe is that?  And whats the flavour like?  And wth do you even do with a tomatoe that big You make Texas size BLT's.........
looks like a pumpkin.  Awesome.  I have a pile of half pound tomatoes...I just need them to rippen
When making a toasted tomato sandwich, you slice the mater in 1/2 and put the toast in the middle.
That is a fine looking tomato. We have a lot of beefsteak tomatoes in the 1 1/2 to 1 3/4lb size that we have been harvesting over the past week. We even have a donut that would put Timmies to shame.

Bruce for the size there were not a  lot of seeds probably around 60 if that. It was all pulp. I have another coming at 1.5 at the most. I will dry the seeds.  Yeasterday we Jarred 15 bushels, close to 300 jars.

Often you will not get that many seeds from the monster tomatoes. How big was the root core?  I remember the days of bottling sugo back in the day. We'd pick 100 bushels,  as a group, on the Saturday. Then Sunday was spent blanching, grinding and bottling. By 4 in the afternoon, all was done, and the men were more than a little ubriaco.
I planted the seeds but it was cold in the garage and  the plants I did get wern't very big my the end of May.  yes there tends ro be a little bit of drinking when tomato day comes around!
